questions.question_text: Which Word feature allows you to create different column layouts within the same document?
questions.explanation: Section breaks allow you to divide a document into sections with different formatting, such as varying column layouts on the same page.

questions.question_text: What is the keyboard shortcut to insert a column break in Word?
questions.explanation: Ctrl + Shift + Enter inserts a column break, forcing text to move to the next column in a multi-column layout.

questions.question_text: Which tab in the Word ribbon contains the Columns option?
questions.explanation: The Columns option is located in the Layout tab under the Page Setup group.

questions.question_text: What type of section break allows you to change column formatting on the same page?
questions.explanation: A Continuous section break allows different formatting (like column layouts) within the same page.

questions.question_text: Which tool allows you to quickly copy formatting from one piece of text to another?
questions.explanation: The Format Painter tool (paintbrush icon) copies formatting from selected text and applies it to other text.

questions.question_text: How can you apply a shadow text effect to a title in Word?
options: Home tab → Font group → Text Effects and Typography → Shadow
Design tab → Document Formatting → Text Effects
Layout tab → Page Setup → Text Effects
questions.explanation: Text effects including shadows are found in the Home tab, Font group, under Text Effects and Typography.

questions.question_text: What is the maximum number of columns you can create in a Word document using the standard Columns dialog box?
questions.explanation: Word allows up to 13 columns in a document through the Columns dialog box (Layout → Columns → More Columns).

questions.question_text: Which option in the Columns dialog box adds a vertical line between columns?
questions.explanation: The 'Line between' checkbox in the Columns dialog box adds vertical lines separating columns.

questions.question_text: What happens when you double-click the Format Painter button?
options: It applies formatting to multiple selections until turned off
It copies formatting twice as fast
It opens the Format Painter options dialog
questions.explanation: Double-clicking the Format Painter locks it on, allowing you to apply the same formatting to multiple text selections. Press Esc to turn it off.

questions.question_text: Which view is most useful for working with multi-column layouts in Word?
questions.explanation: Print Layout view shows the document as it will appear when printed, including column layouts, making it ideal for working with columns.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of applying the 'Title' style to a newsletter heading?
options: It adds the document to the Navigation Pane
questions.explanation: The Title style applies consistent formatting (font, size, spacing) and can be centered. It also automatically adds the title to the Navigation Pane if headings are shown.

questions.question_text: Which keyboard shortcut activates the Format Painter after selecting text with desired formatting?
questions.explanation: Both Ctrl + Shift + C (copy formatting) and Alt + H, F, P (ribbon shortcut) activate the Format Painter.

questions.question_text: What is the main advantage of using section breaks instead of multiple documents for a newsletter?
options: Ability to have different column layouts within one document
questions.explanation: Section breaks allow different formatting (like columns) within one document while maintaining consistent page numbering and headers/footers across sections.

questions.question_text: How can you ensure text starts at the top of the next column without filling the current column?
questions.explanation: A column break (Ctrl + Shift + Enter) forces text to move to the next column, regardless of how much space remains in the current column.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a type of section break available in Word?
questions.explanation: Column Break is a page break type, not a section break type. Section breaks include: Next Page, Continuous, Even Page, and Odd Page.
